Dialogue.NPCText:
Before you stands a statuesque woman, her eyes as deep and ageless as the shifting dunes. Robes shimmer with mirage-like hues, a topaz sash glowing at her waist. From beneath the translucent Veil of the Dune Ancients, she surveys you with inscrutable calm.

"A child of the wind and sand approaches. I am Yasmin al-Topaz, Mistress of the Sands, last archivist of the Desert Ancients and keeper of secrets that even time itself has forgotten.
Speak: have you come seeking lost knowledge, a place in the histories of Qasaria, or are you merely another suitor for the Council’s tangled favor?"

Option.text: I seek knowledge—perhaps work for one as learned as you.
Who are you, Yasmin al-Topaz?
Tell me of the Council of Jewels.
What are these relics of the Desert Ancients?
Tell me something... personal. Who is Yasmin al-Topaz, really?
I'm just a traveler passing through.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Yasmin’s gaze flickers, old memories stirring.

"Long before the merchant-princes squabbled over Qasaria, I wandered the trackless sands in the company of mystics and outcasts. I have walked with living pharaohs and witnessed the fall of empires whose very names now blow on the wind.
My longevity is no mere accident: I have sipped forbidden draughts, bartered my shadow to the Obelisk, and seen friends fade while I endure. To some I am an oracle, to others—a relic myself.

Karim al-Emerald, my closest confidante, says I am both blessing and curse to this city. But knowledge is weighty, and the past clings as stubbornly as sand in the wind."

Option.text: Karim al-Emerald? Tell me of him.
Do you regret your immortality?
How does your history help Qasaria now?
Let us speak of the present. Have you work for me?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Yasmin allows a rare, soft laugh.

"Karim al-Emerald: diplomat, spy, and more subtle than the shifting dunes. For all his shadows, his loyalty to Qasaria is unwavering. Together, we share secrets, and sometimes even trust.
He and I have kept this city from ruin more than once, though each time we dance a little closer to the fire. Beware his honeyed words—no serpent bites without first coiling."

Option.text: What of the other councilors?
You seem close. Is that ever a danger?
Let us speak of your work.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Yasmin’s eyes narrow, the smile vanishing.

"To be close to a master of secrets is to be in constant peril. Our alliance is forged in necessity, not romance. Should the wind shift, I would mourn—but I would endure.
Enough. You are not here to pry at old wounds."

Option.text: I meant no offense. Let us speak of your work.
Tell me of the Council of Jewels.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Regret? Sometimes. But regret is a luxury of those with short lives. I have outlived loves, enemies, and even my own ambitions. Now, only Qasaria and its secrets remain."
Yasmin’s hand unconsciously touches her Grips of the Forgotten Pharaohs.

Option.text: How does your history help Qasaria now?
Let us move to matters of the present.

Dialogue.NPCText: "Knowledge is power—and power is survival. I guard what should not be known and reveal what must be shared. Even now, Minax’s shadows creep across the dunes; only ancient wisdom can blunt her advance."

Option.text: Is Minax truly so dangerous?
Do you have a task for me?

Dialogue.NPCText:
"The Council of Jewels: five crowns, each vying for supremacy. Sultan Rafiq al-Ruby wields armies, but his heart is as fragile as the glass towers. Safiya al-Sapphire counts coin and whispers with pirates—her loyalty is ever for sale.
Omar al-Onyx rules the arena, and through chaos, seeks order. As for myself and Karim… we keep the secrets, and sometimes each other.
Our unity is an illusion. Yet in crisis, we remain the world’s last city of wonders."

Option.text: Why so much rivalry?
Tell me of the ancient relics you study.
Let us speak of work.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Yasmin’s gaze hardens.

"Power is a mirage: always in sight, never in hand. Each jewel of the Council seeks to outshine the others. Yet should Minax shatter the world, all our rivalries will turn to dust.
That is why I seek new hands—perhaps yours—to act where the Council cannot."

Option.text: What task do you offer?
What is Minax’s true aim in Qasaria?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Yasmin’s eyes glint with secret pride.

"The Desert Ancients shaped this land before even Lord British’s first dream. Their relics lie buried, whispering power: the Heart of the Dunes, the Obelisk of Eternity, shards of the very Gem of Immortality.
Some councilors would sell these wonders for a seat at Minax’s table. I will see them guarded or used, never squandered.
If you seek fortune and peril, perhaps you will aid me in securing one such relic."

Option.text: I would help you recover a relic.
Tell me more of the Heart of the Dunes.
What is the Obelisk of Eternity?

Dialogue.NPCText:
"The Heart of the Dunes is no mere trinket—it pulses with the essence of the ancient sands. Some believe it can restore or destroy, depending on whose hand wields it.
Even Minax herself covets it. Which is why it must not fall into the wrong hands."

Option.text: How can I aid you?
Tell me of other relics.

Dialogue.NPCText: "The Obelisk of Eternity is the last standing monument of the Ancients, set in the Sun Temple. Its power is a mystery even to me, though the High Priestess believes it can reveal the fate of Lord British—or perhaps open a path to another world."

Option.text: Let us speak of your work.
Tell me of the Heart of the Dunes.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Yasmin’s voice grows distant.

"Then tread lightly. Qasaria is a city of masks—wear yours well, traveler."

Option.text: On second thought, I would serve you.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Yasmin leans close, her voice dropping to a conspiratorial whisper.

"A fragment of the Heart of the Dunes has been uncovered beneath the city. Minax’s agents and even my fellow councilors would claim it. I trust only those who owe no allegiance to any jewel.

I require an agent to deliver a sealed relic coffer—warded against scrying and theft—to a trusted Mystic in Frostmere. The journey will be perilous; spies and spirits both will seek you.
Will you bear this burden and earn the favor of the Mistress of the Sands?"

Option.text: I will deliver the coffer to Frostmere.
Why must it go to Frostmere?
What dangers await on this road?
How will I know the Mystic?
This seems too risky for me.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Yasmin produces a box of ancient gold and glass, covered in glyphs that shimmer with a faint light.

"Take this, and guard it as you would your own soul. Deliver it to Sorin the Pale in Frostmere—he will recognize you by this token: a single topaz crystal bound with a thread of my sash.

Return with proof of delivery, and you shall know gratitude rare in Qasaria. Fail, and the desert itself may deny you refuge."

Option.text: I will not fail you, Mistress of the Sands.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Frostmere is untouched by Qasaria’s rivalries, its obelisk warded against Minax. There, our relic will be safe, and Sorin the Pale will study it without the council’s meddling.
Besides, I trust the chill of the north more than the heat of southern ambition."

Option.text: I accept your quest.
I must decline.

Dialogue.NPCText: "You will be hunted. Minax’s cultists prowl the desert roads, and even the council’s spies may test your resolve. Should peril find you, the glyphs on the coffer can unleash a blinding sandstorm—use it only in direst need."

Option.text: I accept the danger.
I will not risk it.

Dialogue.NPCText: "Sorin the Pale is as unmistakable as a snowflake on the dunes—tall, white-haired, and wrapped in furs that never melt. Show him this token, and he will trust you. Speak the words: ‘The sands remember the snow.’"

Option.text: I will seek out Sorin and deliver the coffer.
Thank you for the knowledge. Farewell.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Yasmin’s voice becomes a warning.

"Minax’s reach is long and her patience infinite. She twists desire into weakness, sets friend against friend. More than one councilor has bartered with her, thinking themselves clever.
Trust little, question all. If you serve Qasaria, serve it with open eyes."

Option.text: I will heed your warning.
How have the councilors dealt with her?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Yasmin tilts her head, a flicker of curiosity—or caution—in her gaze.

"Few ask the question directly. Fewer still are prepared for the answer. My story is long, and not all of it is kind.
What truth do you seek, wanderer?"

Option.text: Tell me how you survived so long.
What was Qasaria before the Council of Jewels?
What do you truly love, beneath the robes and power?
What price did you pay to become what you are?
I... wasn't ready for all this.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"My youth ended in fire. I was barely more than an acolyte when the Ancients’ temples collapsed. To preserve what remained, I cast a ritual of suspension... but the sands had their own ideas.

I emerged decades later—alive, unaged. The ritual didn’t just stop time… it fed on it. Now I drink slow waters and avoid mirrors. Every moment I live is borrowed from a future I will never see."

Option.text: Did the spell change your soul?
What happened to the others?
That is... terrifying. Let's talk of something else.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"I dream in foreign memories. Sometimes I speak languages no one recalls. Perhaps I am no longer Yasmin—only a vessel for what she once was.
But I remember music from before cities. I remember the smell of rain before it was rare. That is worth the cost."

Option.text: You've truly lived many lives.
That’s… haunting and beautiful.

Dialogue.NPCText: "They crumbled. The ritual was never meant for more than one. When I emerged, all that remained of my circle were statues of salt and wind-scoured bones. I named the dunes after them, and never spoke their names again... until now."

Option.text: I will remember them, if you name them.
Option.action: SendMessage:You feel the weight of a forgotten name echo in your mind.

Option.text: Let's speak of Qasaria’s past instead.
You deserve peace, Yasmin.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Before the towers, Qasaria was a ruin—scattered tents around broken ziggurats. I arrived with scrolls, fire, and a vision. I taught the desert to bloom and the stars to align over this place.

The first Jewel wasn’t gold—it was knowledge. But others came, with swords, with spice, with silver tongues. Thus was the Council born: from my sanctuary… to a throne-room of thieves."

Option.text: And you stayed?
Was it worth it?

Dialogue.NPCText:
"I stayed because I had to. The world forgets its past unless someone carves it into stone. The relics beneath Qasaria must be guarded—and I am the last who remembers how."
She touches her robes gently, fingers brushing runes older than the Council.

Option.text: What relics lie beneath this city?

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Every age has its price. I mourn what I lost… but this city stands. That is all that matters. When I am dust, it will still rise from the sand."
Her voice carries a quiet certainty—perhaps a hope, or a spell.

Option.text: You've given everything to this city.
May your legacy never fade.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Yasmin blinks in surprise. Then—rare and warm—she smiles.

"A question no assassin ever asks. I love the smell of cinnamon incense in morning light. I love the feel of worn scrolls, and the sound of wind chimes on an empty rooftop. I love… truth, even when it cuts."
She meets your eyes, suddenly vulnerable.

"Why ask that, traveler?"

Option.text: Because you seem lonely.
Because knowing someone’s joys tells more than their titles.
No reason. Curiosity, perhaps.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Yasmin’s smile fades, replaced by stone.

"The price? My family’s names erased. My mortal years—traded. My heart, once warm, now divided between duty and memory.
I know every word of the ancient tongue, yet no lullaby of my childhood."

She turns away for a moment, cloaked in silence.

Option.text: You carry it with grace.
Option.action: SendMessage:She says nothing, but her posture softens slightly.

Option.text: That is a heavy burden. You shouldn't carry it alone.
Thank you for sharing your truth.
